channel.title: high on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in high on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Suspicious WMI Execution Using Rundll32
item.description: Detects WMI executing rundll32

item.title: COM Hijack via Sdclt
item.description: Detects changes to ‘HKCU\Software\Classes\Folder\shell\open\command\DelegateExecute’

item.title: Wannacry Killswitch Domain
item.description: Detects wannacry killswitch domain dns queries

item.title: Vulnerable Netlogon Secure Channel Connection Allowed
item.description: Detects that a vulnerable Netlogon secure channel connection was allowed, which could be an indicator of CVE-2020-1472.

item.title: Windows Defender AMSI Trigger Detected
item.description: Detects triggering of AMSI by Windows Defender.

item.title: Publicly Accessible RDP Service
item.description: Detects connections from routable IPs to an RDP listener - which is indicative of a publicly-accessible RDP service.

item.title: DNSCat2 Powershell Implementation Detection Via Process Creation
item.description: The PowerShell implementation of DNSCat2 calls nslookup to craft queries. Counting nslookup processes spawned by PowerShell will show hundreds or thousands of instances if PS DNSCat2 is active locally.

item.title: Webshell Recon Detection Via CommandLine & Processes
item.description: Looking for processes spawned by web server components that indicate reconnaissance by popular public domain webshells for whether perl, python or wget are installed.

item.title: Avusing Azure Browser SSO
item.description: Detects abusing Azure Browser SSO by requesting OAuth 2.0 refresh tokens for an Azure-AD-authenticated Windows user (i.e. the machine is joined to Azure AD and a user logs in with their Azure AD account) wanting to perform SSO authentication in the browser. An attacker can use this to authenticate to Azure AD in a browser as that user.

item.title: PSExec and WMI Process Creations Block
item.description: Detects blocking of process creations originating from PSExec and WMI commands

item.title: Empire UserAgent URI Combo
item.description: Detects user agent and URI paths used by empire agents

item.title: Regsvr32 Flags Anomaly
item.description: Detects a flag anomaly in which regsvr32.exe uses a /i flag without using a /n flag at the same time

item.title: Windows Defender Threat Detected
item.description: Detects all actions taken by Windows Defender malware detection engines

item.title: Windows Defender Threat Detection Disabled
item.description: Detects disabling Windows Defender threat protection

item.title: Disabled IE Security Features
item.description: Detects command lines that indicate unwanted modifications to registry keys that disable important Internet Explorer security features

item.title: Cmd.exe CommandLine Path Traversal
item.description: detects the usage of path traversal in cmd.exe indicating possible command/argument confusion/hijacking

item.title: Suspicious New Printer Ports in Registry (CVE-2020-1048)
item.description: Detects a new and suspicious printer port creation in Registry that could be an attempt to exploit CVE-2020-1048

item.title: Notepad Making Network Connection
item.description: Detects suspicious network connection by Notepad

item.title: WMImplant Hack Tool
item.description: Detects parameters used by WMImplant

item.title: Suspicious ADSI-Cache Usage By Unknown Tool
item.description: Detects the usage of ADSI (LDAP) operations by tools. This may also detect tools like LDAPFragger.

item.title: Suspicious LDAP-Attributes Used
item.description: Detects the usage of particular AttributeLDAPDisplayNames, which are known for data exchange via LDAP by the tool LDAPFragger and are additionally not commonly used in companies.

item.title: PowerShell DownloadFile
item.description: Detects the execution of powershell, a WebClient object creation and the invocation of DownloadFile in a single command line

item.title: CVE-2020-0688 Exploitation via Eventlog
item.description: Detects the exploitation of Microsoft Exchange vulnerability as described in CVE-2020-0688

item.title: CVE-2020-0688 Exploitation Attempt
item.description: Detects CVE-2020-0688 Exploitation attempts

item.title: Active Directory Kerberos DLL Loaded Via Office Applications
item.description: Detects Kerberos DLL being loaded by an Office Product

item.title: Active Directory Parsing DLL Loaded Via Office Applications
item.description: Detects DSParse DLL being loaded by an Office Product

item.title: CLR DLL Loaded Via Office Applications
item.description: Detects CLR DLL being loaded by an Office Product

item.title: dotNET DLL Loaded Via Office Applications
item.description: Detects any assembly DLL being loaded by an Office Product

item.title: GAC DLL Loaded Via Office Applications
item.description: Detects any GAC DLL being loaded by an Office Product

item.title: VBA DLL Loaded Via Microsoft Word
item.description: Detects DLL’s Loaded Via Word Containing VBA Macros

item.title: Process Dump via Rundll32 and Comsvcs.dll
item.description: Detects a process memory dump performed via ordinal function 24 in comsvcs.dll

item.title: Koadic Execution
item.description: Detects command line parameters used by Koadic hack tool

item.title: Wsreset UAC Bypass
item.description: Detects a method that uses Wsreset.exe tool that can be used to reset the Windows Store to bypass UAC

item.title: FromBase64String Command Line
item.description: Detects suspicious FromBase64String expressions in command line arguments

item.title: Renamed ZOHO Dctask64
item.description: Detects a renamed dctask64.exe used for process injection, command execution, process creation with a signed binary by ZOHO Corporation

item.title: ZOHO Dctask64 Process Injection
item.description: Detects suspicious process injection using ZOHO’s dctask64.exe

item.title: MSTSC Shadowing
item.description: Detects RDP session hijacking by using MSTSC shadowing

item.title: Tasks Folder Evasion
item.description: The Tasks folder in system32 and syswow64 are globally writable paths. Adversaries can take advantage of this and load or influence any script hosts or ANY .NET Application in Tasks to load and execute a custom assembly into cscript, wscript, regsvr32, mshta, eventvwr

item.title: Copy from Admin Share
item.description: Detects a suspicious copy command from a remote C$ or ADMIN$ share

item.title: Windows Mangement Instrumentation DLL Loaded Via Microsoft Word
item.description: Detects DLL’s Loaded Via Word Containing VBA Macros Executing WMI Commands

item.title: CreateMiniDump Hacktool
item.description: Detects the use of CreateMiniDump hack tool used to dump the LSASS process memory for credential extraction on the attacker’s machine

item.title: Operation Wocao Activity
item.description: Detects activity mentioned in Operation Wocao report

item.title: Bloodhound and Sharphound Hack Tool
item.description: Detects command line parameters used by Bloodhound and Sharphound hack tools

item.title: RottenPotato Like Attack Pattern
item.description: Detects logon events that have characteristics of events generated during an attack with RottenPotato and the like

item.title: Exploiting SetupComplete.cmd CVE-2019-1378
item.description: Detects exploitation attempt of privilege escalation vulnerability via SetupComplete.cmd and PartnerSetupComplete.cmd decribed in CVE-2019-1378

item.title: Cisco Clear Logs
item.description: Clear command history in network OS which is used for defense evasion

item.title: Cisco Crypto Commands
item.description: Show when private keys are being exported from the device, or when new certificates are installed

item.title: Cisco Disabling Logging
item.description: Turn off logging locally or remote

item.title: Cisco Local Accounts
item.description: Find local accounts being created or modified as well as remote authentication configurations

item.title: Suspicious MsiExec Directory
item.description: Detects suspicious msiexec process starts in an uncommon directory

item.title: Suspicious Windows ANONYMOUS LOGON Local Account Created
item.description: Detects the creation of suspicious accounts simliar to ANONYMOUS LOGON, such as using additional spaces. Created as an covering detection for exclusion of Logon Type 3 from ANONYMOUS LOGON accounts.

item.title: Mustang Panda Dropper
item.description: Detects specific process parameters as used by Mustang Panda droppers

item.title: Suspicious Remote Thread Created
item.description: Offensive tradecraft is switching away from using APIs like “CreateRemoteThread”, however, this is still largely observed in the wild. This rule aims to detect suspicious processes (those we would not expect to behave in this way like word.exe or outlook.exe) creating remote threads on other processes. It is a generalistic rule, but it should have a low FP ratio due to the selected range of processes.

item.title: Load of dbghelp/dbgcore DLL from Suspicious Process
item.description: Detects the load of dbghelp/dbgcore DLL (used to make memory dumps) by suspicious processes. Tools like ProcessHacker and some attacker tradecract use MiniDumpWriteDump API found in dbghelp.dll or dbgcore.dll. As an example, SilentTrynity C2 Framework has a module that leverages this API to dump the contents of Lsass.exe and transfer it over the network back to the attacker’s machine.

item.title: New or Renamed User Account with '$' in Attribute 'SamAccountName'.
item.description: Detects possible bypass EDR and SIEM via abnormal user account name.

item.title: Possible DC Shadow
item.description: Detects DCShadow via create new SPN

item.title: Suspicious Outbound Kerberos Connection
item.description: Detects suspicious outbound network activity via kerberos default port indicating possible lateral movement or first stage PrivEsc via delegation.

item.title: Suspicious Outbound Kerberos Connection
item.description: Detects suspicious outbound network activity via kerberos default port indicating possible lateral movement or first stage PrivEsc via delegation.

item.title: Svchost DLL Search Order Hijack
item.description: IKEEXT and SessionEnv service, as they call LoadLibrary on files that do not exist within C:\Windows\System32\ by default. An attacker can place their malicious logic within the PROCESS_ATTACH block of their library and restart the aforementioned services “svchost.exe -k netsvcs” to gain code execution on a remote machine.

item.title: Bypass UAC via CMSTP
item.description: Detect child processes of automatically elevated instances of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer (cmstp.exe).

item.title: Bypass UAC via Fodhelper.exe
item.description: Identifies use of Fodhelper.exe to bypass User Account Control. Adversaries use this technique to execute privileged processes.

item.title: Bypass UAC via WSReset.exe
item.description: Identifies use of WSReset.exe to bypass User Account Control. Adversaries use this technique to execute privileged processes.

item.title: HH.exe Execution
item.description: Identifies usage of hh.exe executing recently modified .chm files.

item.title: Interactive AT Job
item.description: Detect an interactive AT job, which may be used as a form of privilege escalation

item.title: LSASS Memory Dumping
item.description: Detect creation of dump files containing the memory space of lsass.exe, which contains sensitive credentials. Identifies usage of Sysinternals procdump.exe to export the memory space of lsass.exe which contains sensitive credentials.

item.title: Modification of ld.so.preload
item.description: Identifies modification of ld.so.preload for shared object injection. This technique is used by attackers to load arbitrary code into processes.

item.title: Mshta JavaScript Execution
item.description: Identifies suspicious mshta.exe commands

item.title: Detection of Possible Rotten Potato
item.description: Detection of child processes spawned with SYSTEM privileges by parents with LOCAL SERVICE or NETWORK SERVICE privileges

item.title: Possible Privilege Escalation via Service Permissions Weakness
item.description: Detect modification of services configuration (ImagePath, FailureCommand and ServiceDLL) in registry by processes with Medium integrity level

item.title: Possible Privilege Escalation via Weak Service Permissions
item.description: Detection of sc.exe utility spawning by user with Medium integrity level to change service ImagePath or FailureCommand

item.title: Windows Defender Exclusion Set
item.description: Detects scenarios where an windows defender exclusion was added in registry where an entity would want to bypass antivirus scanning from windows defender

item.title: Malicious Payload Download via Office Binaries
item.description: Downloads payload from remote server

item.title: Auditing Configuration Changes on Linux Host
item.description: Detect changes in auditd configuration files

item.title: Logging Configuration Changes on Linux Host
item.description: Detect changes of syslog daemons configuration files

item.title: Narrator's Feedback-Hub Persistence
item.description: Detects abusing Windows 10 Narrator’s Feedback-Hub

item.title: Regsvr32 Network Activity
item.description: Detects network connections and DNS queries initiated by Regsvr32.exe

item.title: Suspicious Netsh DLL Persistence
item.description: Detects persitence via netsh helper

item.title: Suspicious Service Path Modification
item.description: Detects service path modification to powershell/cmd

item.title: Powershell Profile.ps1 Modification
item.description: Detects a change in profile.ps1 of the Powershell profile

item.title: Remote PowerShell Session
item.description: Detects remote PowerShell connections by monitoring network outbount connections to ports 5985 or 5986 from not network service account

item.title: Remote PowerShell Session
item.description: Detects remote PowerShell sessions

item.title: Remote PowerShell Sessions
item.description: Detects basic PowerShell Remoting by monitoring for network inbound connections to ports 5985 OR 5986

item.title: WMI Modules Loaded
item.description: Detects non wmiprvse loading WMI modules

item.title: RDP Registry Modification
item.description: Detects potential malicious modification of the property value of fDenyTSConnections and UserAuthentication to enable remote desktop connections.

item.title: Suspicious HWP Sub Processes
item.description: Detects suspicious Hangul Word Processor (Hanword) sub processes that could indicate an exploitation

item.title: SILENTTRINITY Stager Execution
item.description: Detects SILENTTRINITY stager use

item.title: Sysmon Driver Unload
item.description: Detect possible Sysmon driver unload

item.title: OpenWith.exe Executes Specified Binary
item.description: The OpenWith.exe executes other binary

item.title: Suspicious Call by Ordinal
item.description: Detects suspicious calls of DLLs in rundll32.dll exports by ordinal

item.title: Crypto Miner User Agent
item.description: Detects suspicious user agent strings used by crypto miners in proxy logs

item.title: DLL Load via LSASS
item.description: Detects a method to load DLL via LSASS process using an undocumented Registry key

item.title: Suspicious Compression Tool Parameters
item.description: Detects suspicious command line arguments of common data compression tools

item.title: Suspicious Csc.exe Source File Folder
item.description: Detects a suspicious execution of csc.exe, which uses a source in a suspicious folder (e.g. AppData)

item.title: Hacktool Ruler
item.description: This events that are generated when using the hacktool Ruler by Sensepost

item.title: Highly Relevant Renamed Binary
item.description: Detects the execution of a renamed binary often used by attackers or malware leveraging new Sysmon OriginalFileName datapoint.

item.title: Potential RDP Exploit CVE-2019-0708
item.description: Detect suspicious error on protocol RDP, potential CVE-2019-0708

item.title: Windows 10 Scheduled Task SandboxEscaper 0-day
item.description: Detects Task Scheduler .job import arbitrary DACL write\par

item.title: Terminal Service Process Spawn
item.description: Detects a process spawned by the terminal service server process (this could be an indicator for an exploitation of CVE-2019-0708)

item.title: Renamed PsExec
item.description: Detects the execution of a renamed PsExec often used by attackers or malware

item.title: Mimikatz through Windows Remote Management
item.description: Detects usage of mimikatz through WinRM protocol by monitoring access to lsass process by wsmprovhost.exe.

item.title: Malicious Nishang PowerShell Commandlets
item.description: Detects Commandlet names and arguments from the Nishang exploitation framework

item.title: Suspicious Outbound RDP Connections
item.description: Detects Non-Standard Tools Connecting to TCP port 3389 indicating possible lateral movement

item.title: Suspicious Scripting in a WMI Consumer
item.description: Detects suspicious scripting in WMI Event Consumers

item.title: Possible DNS Tunneling
item.description: Normally, DNS logs contain a limited amount of different dns queries for a single domain. This rule detects a high amount of queries for a single domain, which can be an indicator that DNS is used to transfer data.

item.title: Clear Command History
item.description: Clear command history in linux which is used for defense evasion.

item.title: MSHTA Suspicious Execution 01
item.description: Detection for mshta.exe suspicious execution patterns sometimes involving file polyglotism

item.title: Baby Shark Activity
item.description: Detects activity that could be related to Baby Shark malware

item.title: RDP Over Reverse SSH Tunnel
item.description: Detects svchost hosting RDP termsvcs communicating with the loopback address and on TCP port 3389

item.title: RDP over Reverse SSH Tunnel WFP
item.description: Detects svchost hosting RDP termsvcs communicating with the loopback address

item.title: Suspicious PowerShell Keywords
item.description: Detects keywords that could indicate the use of some PowerShell exploitation framework

item.title: RDP Login from Localhost
item.description: RDP login with localhost source address may be a tunnelled login

item.title: Activity Related to NTDS.dit Domain Hash Retrieval
item.description: Detects suspicious commands that could be related to activity that uses volume shadow copy to steal and retrieve hashes from the NTDS.dit file remotely

item.title: Adwind RAT / JRAT
item.description: Detects javaw.exe in AppData folder as used by Adwind / JRAT

item.title: CMSTP UAC Bypass via COM Object Access
item.description: Detects UAC Bypass Attempt Using Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer Autoelevate-capable COM Objects

item.title: Detection of PowerShell Execution via DLL
item.description: Detects PowerShell Strings applied to rundll as seen in PowerShdll.dll

item.title: Executables Started in Suspicious Folder
item.description: Detects process starts of binaries from a suspicious folder

item.title: Execution in Non-Executable Folder
item.description: Detects a suspicious exection from an uncommon folder

item.title: File Created with System Process Name
item.description: Detects the creation of a executable with a system process name in a suspicious folder

item.title: Invocation of Active Directory Diagnostic Tool (ntdsutil.exe)
item.description: Detects execution of ntdsutil.exe, which can be used for various attacks against the NTDS database (NTDS.DIT)

item.title: Malicious Base64 Encoded PowerShell Keywords in Command Lines
item.description: Detects base64 encoded strings used in hidden malicious PowerShell command lines

item.title: Microsoft Office Product Spawning Windows Shell
item.description: Detects a Windows command and scripting interpreter executable started from Microsoft Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Publisher and Visio

item.title: Microsoft Workflow Compiler
item.description: Detects invocation of Microsoft Workflow Compiler, which may permit the execution of arbitrary unsigned code.

item.title: MMC Spawning Windows Shell
item.description: Detects a Windows command line executable started from MMC

item.title: MSHTA Spawning Windows Shell
item.description: Detects a Windows command line executable started from MSHTA

item.title: MSHTA Spwaned by SVCHOST
item.description: Detects MSHTA.EXE spwaned by SVCHOST as seen in LethalHTA and described in report

item.title: Ping Hex IP
item.description: Detects a ping command that uses a hex encoded IP address

item.title: Possible Shim Database Persistence via sdbinst.exe
item.description: Detects installation of a new shim using sdbinst.exe. A shim can be used to load malicious DLLs into applications.

item.title: Powershell AMSI Bypass via .NET Reflection
item.description: Detects Request to amsiInitFailed that can be used to disable AMSI Scanning

item.title: Regsvr32 Anomaly
item.description: Detects various anomalies in relation to regsvr32.exe

item.title: Shells Spawned by Web Servers
item.description: Web servers that spawn shell processes could be the result of a successfully placed web shell or an other attack

item.title: Suspicious Certutil Command
item.description: Detects a suspicious Microsoft certutil execution with sub commands like ‘decode’ sub command, which is sometimes used to decode malicious code with the built-in certutil utility

item.title: Suspicious Control Panel DLL Load
item.description: Detects suspicious Rundll32 execution from control.exe as used by Equation Group and Exploit Kits

item.title: Suspicious Encoded PowerShell Command Line
item.description: Detects suspicious powershell process starts with base64 encoded commands (e.g. Emotet)

item.title: Suspicious PowerShell Parameter Substring
item.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation with a parameter substring

item.title: Suspicious RDP Redirect Using TSCON
item.description: Detects a suspicious RDP session redirect using tscon.exe

item.title: Suspicious TSCON Start
item.description: Detects a tscon.exe start as LOCAL SYSTEM

item.title: Suspicious Use of Procdump
item.description: Detects suspicious uses of the SysInternals Procdump utility by using a special command line parameter in combination with the lsass.exe process. This way we’re also able to catch cases in which the attacker has renamed the procdump executable.

item.title: System File Execution Location Anomaly
item.description: Detects a Windows program executable started in a suspicious folder

item.title: Webshell Detection With Command Line Keywords
item.description: Detects certain command line parameters often used during reconnaissance activity via web shells

item.title: Whoami Execution
item.description: Detects the execution of whoami, which is often used by attackers after exloitation / privilege escalation but rarely used by administrators

item.title: Windows Shell Spawning Suspicious Program
item.description: Detects a suspicious child process of a Windows shell

item.title: WMI Persistence - Script Event Consumer
item.description: Detects WMI script event consumers

item.title: WScript or CScript Dropper
item.description: Detects wscript/cscript executions of scripts located in user directories

item.title: WMI Event Subscription
item.description: Detects creation of WMI event subscription persistence method

item.title: CobaltStrike Process Injection
item.description: Detects a possible remote threat creation with certain characteristics which are typical for Cobalt Strike beacons

item.title: CobaltStrike Malleable (OCSP) Profile
item.description: Detects Malleable (OCSP) Profile with Typo (OSCP) in URL

item.title: CobaltStrike Malleable OneDrive Browsing Traffic Profile
item.description: Detects Malleable OneDrive Profile

item.title: LSASS Access Detected via Attack Surface Reduction
item.description: Detects Access to LSASS Process

item.title: Detection of SafetyKatz
item.description: Detects possible SafetyKatz Behaviour

item.title: NTFS Alternate Data Stream
item.description: Detects writing data into NTFS alternate data streams from powershell. Needs Script Block Logging.

item.title: Registry Persistence via Explorer Run Key
item.description: Detects a possible persistence mechanism using RUN key for Windows Explorer and pointing to a suspicious folder

item.title: CMSTP Execution
item.description: Detects various indicators of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer execution

item.title: CMSTP Execution
item.description: Detects various indicators of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer execution

item.title: CMSTP Execution
item.description: Detects various indicators of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer execution

item.title: PowerShell Rundll32 Remote Thread Creation
item.description: Detects PowerShell remote thread creation in Rundll32.exe

item.title: Default PowerSploit and Empire Schtasks Persistence
item.description: Detects the creation of a schtask via PowerSploit or Empire Default Configuration.

item.title: Cobalt Strike DNS Beaconing
item.description: Detects suspicious DNS queries known from Cobalt Strike beacons

item.title: Taskmgr as LOCAL_SYSTEM
item.description: Detects the creation of taskmgr.exe process in context of LOCAL_SYSTEM

item.title: Suspicious Named Error
item.description: Detects suspicious DNS error messages that indicate a fatal or suspicious error that could be caused by exploiting attempts

item.title: Successful Overpass the Hash Attempt
item.description: Detects successful logon with logon type 9 (NewCredentials) which matches the Overpass the Hash behavior of e.g Mimikatz’s sekurlsa::pth module.

item.title: Hurricane Panda Activity
item.description: Detects Hurricane Panda Activity

item.title: Suspicious SQL Error Messages
item.description: Detects SQL error messages that indicate probing for an injection attack

item.title: Disabling Windows Event Auditing
item.description: Detects scenarios where system auditing (ie: windows event log auditing) is disabled. This may be used in a scenario where an entity would want to bypass local logging to evade detection when windows event logging is enabled and reviewed. Also, it is recommended to turn off “Local Group Policy Object Processing” via GPO, which will make sure that Active Directory GPOs take precedence over local/edited computer policies via something such as “gpedit.msc”. Please note, that disabling “Local Group Policy Object Processing” may cause an issue in scenarios of one off specific GPO modifications – however it is recommended to perform these modifications in Active Directory anyways.

item.title: Flash Player Update from Suspicious Location
item.description: Detects a flashplayer update from an unofficial location

item.title: Ps.exe Renamed SysInternals Tool
item.description: Detects renamed SysInternals tool execution with a binary named ps.exe as used by Dragonfly APT group and documented in TA17-293A report

item.title: New RUN Key Pointing to Suspicious Folder
item.description: Detects suspicious new RUN key element pointing to an executable in a suspicious folder

item.title: Microsoft Binary Github Communication
item.description: Detects an executable in the Windows folder accessing github.com

item.title: Microsoft Binary Suspicious Communication Endpoint
item.description: Detects an executable in the Windows folder accessing suspicious domains

item.title: DHCP Callout DLL Installation
item.description: Detects the installation of a Callout DLL via CalloutDlls and CalloutEnabled parameter in Registry, which can be used to execute code in context of the DHCP server (restart required)

item.title: Equation Group C2 Communication
item.description: Detects communication to C2 servers mentioned in the operational notes of the ShadowBroker leak of EquationGroup C2 tools

item.title: Turla Service Install
item.description: This method detects a service install of malicious services mentioned in Carbon Paper - Turla report by ESET

item.title: SAM Dump to AppData
item.description: Detects suspicious SAM dump activity as cause by QuarksPwDump and other password dumpers

item.title: Suspicious Program Location with Network Connections
item.description: Detects programs with network connections running in suspicious files system locations

item.title: UAC Bypass via Sdclt
item.description: Detects changes to HKCU:\Software\Classes\exefile\shell\runas\command\isolatedCommand

item.title: Suspicious Activity in Shell Commands
item.description: Detects suspicious shell commands used in various exploit codes (see references)

item.title: Shellshock Expression
item.description: Detects shellshock expressions in log files

item.title: Windows WebDAV User Agent
item.description: Detects WebDav DownloadCradle

item.title: Suspicious PowerShell Invocations - Generic
item.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation command parameters

item.title: Apache Segmentation Fault
item.description: Detects a segmentation fault error message caused by a creashing apache worker process

item.title: Password Change on Directory Service Restore Mode (DSRM) Account
item.description: The Directory Service Restore Mode (DSRM) account is a local administrator account on Domain Controllers. Attackers may change the password to gain persistence.

item.title: Credentials Dumping Tools Accessing LSASS Memory
item.description: Detects process access LSASS memory which is typical for credentials dumping tools

item.title: Kerberos Manipulation
item.description: This method triggers on rare Kerberos Failure Codes caused by manipulations of Kerberos messages

item.title: Password Dumper Activity on LSASS
item.description: Detects process handle on LSASS process with certain access mask and object type SAM_DOMAIN

item.title: Password Dumper Remote Thread in LSASS
item.description: Detects password dumper activity by monitoring remote thread creation EventID 8 in combination with the lsass.exe process as TargetImage. The process in field Process is the malicious program. A single execution can lead to hundreds of events.

item.title: Webshell Detection by Keyword
item.description: Detects webshells that use GET requests by keyword searches in URL strings

item.title: Relevant Anti-Virus Event
item.description: This detection method points out highly relevant Antivirus events

item.title: Account Tampering - Suspicious Failed Logon Reasons
item.description: This method uses uncommon error codes on failed logons to determine suspicious activity and tampering with accounts that have been disabled or somehow restricted.

item.title: Security Eventlog Cleared
item.description: Some threat groups tend to delete the local ‘Security’ Eventlog using certain utitlities

item.title: AD Privileged Users or Groups Reconnaissance
item.description: Detect priv users or groups recon based on 4661 eventid and known privileged users or groups SIDs

item.title: Antivirus Relevant File Paths Alerts
item.description: Detects an Antivirus alert in a highly relevant file path or with a relevant file name

item.title: APT User Agent
item.description: Detects suspicious user agent strings used in APT malware in proxy logs

item.title: APT40 Dropbox Tool User Agent
item.description: Detects suspicious user agent string of APT40 Dropbox tool

item.title: Bitsadmin to Uncommon TLD
item.description: Detects Bitsadmin connections to domains with uncommon TLDs - https://twitter.com/jhencinski/status/1102695118455349248 - https://isc.sans.edu/forums/diary/Investigating+Microsoft+BITS+Activity/23281/

item.title: Blue Mockingbird
item.description: Attempts to detect system changes made by Blue Mockingbird

item.title: Buffer Overflow Attempts
item.description: Detects buffer overflow attempts in Unix system log files

item.title: CACTUSTORCH Remote Thread Creation
item.description: Detects remote thread creation from CACTUSTORCH as described in references.

item.title: CobaltStrike Malleable Amazon Browsing Traffic Profile
item.description: Detects Malleable Amazon Profile

item.title: Covenant Launcher Indicators
item.description: Detects suspicious command lines used in Covenant luanchers

item.title: CrackMapExec Command Execution
item.description: Detect various execution methods of the CrackMapExec pentesting framework

item.title: CrackMapExec PowerShell Obfuscation
item.description: The CrachMapExec pentesting framework implements a PowerShell obfuscation with some static strings detected by this rule.

item.title: Cred Dump Tools Dropped Files
item.description: Files with well-known filenames (parts of credential dump software or files produced by them) creation

item.title: DIT Snapshot Viewer Use
item.description: Detects the use of Ditsnap tool. Seems to be a tool for ransomware groups.

item.title: DNS ServerLevelPluginDll Install
item.description: Detects the installation of a plugin DLL via ServerLevelPluginDll parameter in Registry, which can be used to execute code in context of the DNS server (restart required)

item.title: DNS TXT Answer with Possible Execution Strings
item.description: Detects strings used in command execution in DNS TXT Answer

item.title: Enabled User Right in AD to Control User Objects
item.description: Detects scenario where if a user is assigned the SeEnableDelegationPrivilege right in Active Directory it would allow control of other AD user objects.

item.title: Equation Group Indicators
item.description: Detects suspicious shell commands used in various Equation Group scripts and tools

item.title: Execution in Outlook Temp Folder
item.description: Detects a suspicious program execution in Outlook temp folder

item.title: Exploit Framework User Agent
item.description: Detects suspicious user agent strings used by exploit / pentest framworks like Metasploit in proxy logs

item.title: Fax Service DLL Search Order Hijack
item.description: The Fax service attempts to load ualapi.dll, which is non-existent. An attacker can then (side)load their own malicious DLL using this service.

item.title: Fireball Archer Install
item.description: Detects Archer malware invocation via rundll32

item.title: First Time Seen Remote Named Pipe
item.description: This detection excludes known namped pipes accessible remotely and notify on newly observed ones, may help to detect lateral movement and remote exec using named pipes

item.title: First Time Seen Remote Named Pipe - Zeek
item.description: This detection excludes known namped pipes accessible remotely and notify on newly observed ones, may help to detect lateral movement and remote exec using named pipes

item.title: Fsutil Suspicious Invocation
item.description: Detects suspicious parameters of fsutil (deleting USN journal, configuring it with small size..). Might be used by ransomwares during the attack (seen by NotPetya and others)

item.title: GALLIUM Artefacts
item.description: Detects artefacts associated with activity group GALLIUM - Microsoft Threat Intelligence Center indicators released in December 2019.

item.title: Generic Password Dumper Activity on LSASS
item.description: Detects process handle on LSASS process with certain access mask

item.title: Guacamole Two Users Sharing Session Anomaly
item.description: Detects suspicious session with two users present

item.title: Hack Tool User Agent
item.description: Detects suspicious user agent strings user by hack tools in proxy logs

item.title: Hijack Legit RDP Session to Move Laterally
item.description: Detects the usage of tsclient share to place a backdoor on the RDP source machine’s startup folder

item.title: HTML Help Shell Spawn
item.description: Detects a suspicious child process of a Microsoft HTML Help system when executing compiled HTML files (.chm)

item.title: In-memory PowerShell
item.description: Detects loading of essential DLL used by PowerShell, but not by the process powershell.exe. Detects meterpreter’s “load powershell” extension.

item.title: JexBoss Command Sequence
item.description: Detects suspicious command sequence that JexBoss

item.title: Lazarus Session Highjacker
item.description: Detects executables launched outside their default directories as used by Lazarus Group (Bluenoroff)

item.title: Logon Scripts (UserInitMprLogonScript) Registry
item.description: Detects creation or execution of UserInitMprLogonScript persistence method

item.title: LSASS Memory Dump
item.description: Detects process LSASS memory dump using procdump or taskmgr based on the CallTrace pointing to dbghelp.dll or dbgcore.dll for win10

item.title: Malicious PowerShell Commandlet Names
item.description: Detects the creation of known powershell scripts for exploitation

item.title: Malicious PowerShell Commandlets
item.description: Detects Commandlet names from well-known PowerShell exploitation frameworks

item.title: Malicious PowerShell Keywords
item.description: Detects keywords from well-known PowerShell exploitation frameworks

item.title: Malware Shellcode in Verclsid Target Process
item.description: Detects a process access to verclsid.exe that injects shellcode from a Microsoft Office application / VBA macro

item.title: Malware User Agent
item.description: Detects suspicious user agent strings used by malware in proxy logs

item.title: Metasploit SMB Authentication
item.description: Alerts on Metasploit host’s authentications on the domain.

item.title: Microsoft Malware Protection Engine Crash
item.description: This rule detects a suspicious crash of the Microsoft Malware Protection Engine

item.title: Mimikatz Detection LSASS Access
item.description: Detects process access to LSASS which is typical for Mimikatz (0x1000 PROCESS_QUERY_ LIMITED_INFORMATION, 0x0400 PROCESS_QUERY_ INFORMATION “only old versions”, 0x0010 PROCESS_VM_READ)

item.title: MMC20 Lateral Movement
item.description: Detects MMC20.Application Lateral Movement; specifically looks for the spawning of the parent MMC.exe with a command line of “-Embedding” as a child of svchost.exe

item.title: MS Office Product Spawning Exe in User Dir
item.description: Detects an executable in the users directory started from Microsoft Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Publisher or Visio

item.title: Netsh Program Allowed with Suspcious Location
item.description: Detects Netsh commands that allows a suspcious application location on Windows Firewall

item.title: Netsh RDP Port Forwarding
item.description: Detects netsh commands that configure a port forwarding of port 3389 used for RDP

item.title: Netsh RDP Port Opening
item.description: Detects netsh commands that opens the port 3389 used for RDP, used in Sarwent Malware

item.title: Octopus Scanner Malware
item.description: Detects Octopus Scanner Malware.

item.title: Office Security Settings Changed
item.description: Detects registry changes to Office macro settings

item.title: Oracle WebLogic Exploit CVE-2020-14882
item.description: Detects exploitation attempts on WebLogic servers

item.title: Persistence and Execution at Scale via GPO Scheduled Task
item.description: Detect lateral movement using GPO scheduled task, usually used to deploy ransomware at scale

item.title: Possible Impacket SecretDump Remote Activity
item.description: Detect AD credential dumping using impacket secretdump HKTL

item.title: Possible Impacket SecretDump Remote Activity - Zeek
item.description: Detect AD credential dumping using impacket secretdump HKTL. Based on the SIGMA rules/windows/builtin/win_impacket_secretdump.yml

item.title: Possible Process Hollowing Image Loading
item.description: Detects Loading of samlib.dll, WinSCard.dll from untypical process e.g. through process hollowing by Mimikatz

item.title: PowerShell Called from an Executable Version Mismatch
item.description: Detects PowerShell called from an executable by the version mismatch method

item.title: PowerShell Credential Prompt
item.description: Detects PowerShell calling a credential prompt

item.title: PowerShell Encoded Character Syntax
item.description: Detects suspicious encoded character syntax often used for defense evasion

item.title: PowerShell PSAttack
item.description: Detects the use of PSAttack PowerShell hack tool

item.title: Raw Paste Service Access
item.description: Detects direct access to raw pastes in different paste services often used by malware in their second stages to download malicious code in encrypted or encoded form

item.title: RDP Sensitive Settings Changed
item.description: Detects changes to RDP terminal service sensitive settings

item.title: RedMimicry Winnti Playbook Dropped File
item.description: Detects actions caused by the RedMimicry Winnti playbook

item.title: RedMimicry Winnti Playbook Execute
item.description: Detects actions caused by the RedMimicry Winnti playbook

item.title: RedMimicry Winnti Playbook Registry Manipulation
item.description: Detects actions caused by the RedMimicry Winnti playbook

item.title: Relevant ClamAV Message
item.description: Detects relevant ClamAV messages

item.title: Renamed jusched.exe
item.description: Detects renamed jusched.exe used by cobalt group

item.title: Renamed SysInternals Debug View
item.description: Detects suspicious renamed SysInternals DebugView execution

item.title: Run PowerShell Script from ADS
item.description: Detects PowerShell script execution from Alternate Data Stream (ADS)

item.title: Run Whoami as SYSTEM
item.description: Detects a whoami.exe executed by LOCAL SYSTEM. This may be a sign of a successful local privilege escalation.

item.title: Squirrel Lolbin
item.description: Detects Possible Squirrel Packages Manager as Lolbin

item.title: StoneDrill Service Install
item.description: This method detects a service install of the malicious Microsoft Network Realtime Inspection Service service described in StoneDrill report by Kaspersky

item.title: Suspect Svchost Memory Asccess
item.description: Detects suspect access to svchost process memory such as that used by Invoke-Phantom to kill the winRM windows event logging service.

item.title: Suspicious Calculator Usage
item.description: Detects suspicious use of calc.exe with command line parameters or in a suspicious directory, which is likely caused by some PoC or detection evasion

item.title: Suspicious Camera and Microphone Access
item.description: Detects Processes accessing the camera and microphone from suspicious folder

item.title: Suspicious Debugger Registration Cmdline
item.description: Detects the registration of a debugger for a program that is available in the logon screen (sticky key backdoor).

item.title: Suspicious Desktopimgdownldr Command
item.description: Detects a suspicious Microsoft desktopimgdownldr execution with parameters used to download files from the Internet

item.title: Suspicious Esentutl Use
item.description: Detects flags often used with the LOLBAS Esentutl for malicious activity. It could be used in rare cases by administrators to access locked files or during maintenance.

item.title: Suspicious Eventlog Clear or Configuration Using Wevtutil
item.description: Detects clearing or configuration of eventlogs uwing wevtutil, powershell and wmic. Might be used by ransomwares during the attack (seen by NotPetya and others)

item.title: Suspicious Execution from Outlook
item.description: Detects EnableUnsafeClientMailRules used for Script Execution from Outlook

item.title: Suspicious GUP Usage
item.description: Detects execution of the Notepad++ updater in a suspicious directory, which is often used in DLL side-loading attacks

item.title: Suspicious Parent of Csc.exe
item.description: Detects a suspicious parent of csc.exe, which could by a sign of payload delivery

item.title: Suspicious PowerShell Invocations - Specific
item.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation command parameters

item.title: Suspicious PrinterPorts Creation (CVE-2020-1048)
item.description: Detects new commands that add new printer port which point to suspicious file

item.title: Suspicious Program Location Process Starts
item.description: Detects programs running in suspicious files system locations

item.title: Suspicious PsExec Execution
item.description: detects execution of psexec or paexec with renamed service name, this rule helps to filter out the noise if psexec is used for legit purposes or if attacker uses a different psexec client other than sysinternal one

item.title: Suspicious PsExec Execution - Zeek
item.description: detects execution of psexec or paexec with renamed service name, this rule helps to filter out the noise if psexec is used for legit purposes or if attacker uses a different psexec client other than sysinternal one

item.title: Suspicious Reverse Shell Command Line
item.description: Detects suspicious shell commands or program code that may be exected or used in command line to establish a reverse shell

item.title: Suspicious RUN Key from Download
item.description: Detects the suspicious RUN keys created by software located in Download or temporary Outlook/Internet Explorer directories

item.title: Suspicious Use of CSharp Interactive Console
item.description: Detects the execution of CSharp interactive console by PowerShell

item.title: TropicTrooper Campaign November 2018
item.description: Detects TropicTrooper activity, an actor who targeted high-profile organizations in the energy and food and beverage sectors in Asia

item.title: Unidentified Attacker November 2018
item.description: A sigma rule detecting an unidetefied attacker who used phishing emails to target high profile orgs on November 2018. The Actor shares some TTPs with YYTRIUM/APT29 campaign in 2016.

item.title: Webshell ReGeorg Detection Via Web Logs
item.description: Certain strings in the uri_query field when combined with null referer and null user agent can indicate activity associated with the webshell ReGeorg.

item.title: WMI Persistence - Command Line Event Consumer
item.description: Detects WMI command line event consumers

item.title: WMI Persistence - Script Event Consumer File Write
item.description: Detects file writes of WMI script event consumer

item.title: WMI Spawning Windows PowerShell
item.description: Detects WMI spawning PowerShell
